title-group.article-title: A Bound on the $L_\infty$-Norm of $L_2$-Approximation by Splines in Terms of a Global Mesh Ratio

abstract.p: Let $L_k$f denote the least-squares approximation of $f \in$ L$_1$ by splines of order $k$ with knot sequence t = $(t_i)_1^{n+k}$. In connection with their work on Galerkin's method for solving differential equations, Douglas, Dupont and Wahlbin have shown that the norm $\parallel$L$_k\parallel_{\infty}$ of $L_k$ as a map on L$_{\infty}$ can be bounded as follows, $\parallel$L$_k\parallel_{\infty} \leqslant$ const$_k$M$_t$, with $M_t$ a global mesh ratio, given by $M_t$: = $\operatornamewithlimits{max}_i \Delta$ t$_i$/min $\{\Delta t_i$|$\delta t_i$ > 0$\}$. Using their very nice idea together with some facts about $B$-splines, it is shown here that even $\parallel$L$_k\parallel_\infty \leqslant$ const$_k$ (M$^{(k)}_t)^{1/2}$ with the smaller global mesh ratio $M^{(k)}_t$ given by $M^{(k)}_t$:= $\operatornamewithlimits{max}_{i,j} (t_{i+k} - t_i)$/(t$_{j+k}$- t$_j$). A mesh independent bound for $L_2$-approximation by continuous piecewise polynomials is also given.
